meanings.definition: A person who has been taken prisoner or confined.
meanings.sent1: The captives were rescued by the brave soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The captives were kept in a dark dungeon.
meanings.sent3: The captives tried to escape by digging a tunnel with a spoon.
meanings.sent4: The captives felt like caged birds, longing for freedom.
meanings.sent5: The image of the captives behind bars haunted his dreams.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are being held against their will.
meanings.sent1: The captives were all tied up and unable to move.
meanings.sent2: The captives were guarded closely by the enemy soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The captives played a game of charades to pass the time.
meanings.sent4: The captives felt like pieces on a chessboard, controlled by others.
meanings.sent5: The captives' cries for help echoed through the empty halls.
